title: Ticket #3396: Classads dirtyAttrList  not copied by copy ctor
description: The new classad copy constructor unconditionally turns on the dirty attr tracking flag, regards of the setting in either the source or destination ad. It also doesn't copy the dirtyAttrList itself. The copy ctor should make a copy of the state of the from ad by reproducing both the flag and the array. This will allow us to turn off dirty Attr tracking for the many daemons which don't need it, a performance improvement of up to 25% in classad parsing.
remarks:
2013-Jan-04 12:07:53 by jfrey:
Code Review

  • Remove EnableDirtyTracking() in all constructors for compat_classad::ClassAd. Currently, you've only changed the default constructor.

  • The handling of dirty tracking in ClassAd::CopyFrom() is better, but still odd. It should either clone the entire dirty state of the source ad or not copy any dirty state from the source ad.

  • Add to end of RoutedJob::SetDestJobAd(): 
        dest_ad.EnableDirtyTracking()

  • In ClassAdLog, the ads have dirty tracking enabled, but the LogSetAttribute log record explicitly sets the dirty state of every modified attribute, setting it to false in the vast majority of cases. We can get some additional performance benefits by disabling dirty tracking in ClassAdLog and letting ClassAdLog explicitly manage the dirty state when desired.

2013-Jan-07 10:03:05 by jfrey:
Ignore my comment about the dirty attribute list in ClassAd::CopyFrom(). I see that you are copying the dirty list from the source ad. We should think about just replacing the destination ad's dirty list with a copy of the source ad's list, rather than adding to it.
